hammer.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a tool with a heavy metal part on a long handle, used for hitting nails into wood
hammer.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a tool like this with a wooden head used to make something flat, make a noise etc
hammer.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the part of a gun that hits the explosive charge that fires a bullet
hammer.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a heavy metal ball on a wire with a handle at the end, which you throw as far as possible as a sport
hammer.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a wooden part of a piano that hits the strings inside to make a musical sound
hammer.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to hit something with a hammer in order to force it into a particular position or shape
hammer.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: the sound of hammering and sawing
Hammer the nails into the back of the frame.
All afternoon, Martin had been hammering away in the conservatory.
hammer.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to hit something many times, especially making a loud noise
hammer.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The rain was hammering against the window.
hammer.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to hurt someone or something by causing them a lot of problems
hammer.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: British industry was being hammered by the recession.
hammer.translation[1].definitions[3].def: to hit or kick something very hard
hammer.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: Robinson hammered the ball into the goal.
hammer.translation[1].definitions[4].def: to strongly criticize or attack someone for something they have said or done
hammer.translation[1].definitions[4].exa: The president has been hammered for his lack of leadership.
hammer.translation[1].definitions[5].def: if your heart hammers, you feel it beating strongly and quickly
hammer.translation[1].definitions[5].exa: She stood outside the door, her heart hammering.
hammer.translation[1].definitions[6].def: to defeat someone completely at a sport
hammer.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to be sold at an AUCTION
hammer.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The paintings come under the hammer at Sotheby’s in November.
hammer.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to sell a large amount of stocks, shares etc at one time, causing prices to fall
